item.title: Arya add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "There are things known and there are things unknown, and in between are the doors of perception." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Arya add a quote by Jim Morrison
item.description: "The Gate is Straight, Deep and Wide; Break On Through to the other side." -- Jim Morrison

item.title: Arya add a quote by صادق هدایت
item.description: "خاصیت هر نسلی اینست که آزمایش نسل گذشته را فراموش بکند" -- صادق هدایت

item.title: Arya add a quote by صادق هدایت / Sadegh Hedayat
item.description: "در همین جهان است که دست کم می توانی امیدوار باشی که روزی کلک خودت را بکنی، امیدی که در آن جهان نمی تواند وجود داشته باشد." -- صادق هدایت / Sadegh Hedayat

item.title: Arya add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "I do not pretend to be able to prove that there is no God. I equally cannot prove that Satan is a fiction. The Christian god may exist; so may the gods of Olympus, or of ancient Egypt, or of Babylon. But no one of these hypotheses is more probable than any other: they lie outside the region of even probable knowledge, and therefore there is no reason to consider any of them." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Arya add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "My desire and wish is that the things I start with should be so obvious that you wonder why I spend my time stating them. This is what I aim at because the point of philosophy is to start with something so simple as not to seem worth stating, and to end with something so paradoxical that no one will believe it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Arya add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Arya add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Do not fear to be eccentric in opinion, for every opinion now accepted was once eccentric." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Arya add a quote by Fredrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I assess the power of a will by how much resistance, pain, torture it endures and knows how to turn to its advantage" -- Fredrich Nietzsche

item.title: Arya add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Every heart sings a song, incomplete, until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet." -- Plato

item.title: Arya add a quote by Plato
item.description: "The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men." -- Plato

item.title: Arya add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Music gives a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination and life to everything." -- Plato

item.title: Arya add a quote by Plato
item.description: "There is truth in wine and children" -- Plato

item.title: Arya add a quote by Roger Waters
item.description: "How can you have any pudding if you don't eat your meat?" -- Roger Waters

item.title: Arya add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "Everybody's got to believe in something. I believe I'll have another beer." -- W.C. Fields
